alert.note: Alert for Ochoco-John Day Highlands (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 12:24PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Wheeler, southeastern Jefferson and northwestern Crook Counties through 130 PM PDT... At 1223 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of Prineville, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Wheeler, southeastern Jefferson and northwestern Crook Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
